dimcat.filter package¶

Submodules¶

dimcat.filter.base module¶

A Filter is a PipelineStep that removes indices from the Data.

class dimcat.filter.base.Filter(keep_empty_groups=False)[source]¶

Bases: PipelineStep, ABC

A Filter will process a Data object by removing indices from its list of indices.

abstract criterion(index: tuple, data: Data) → bool[source]¶

Takes one index and (potentially) looks it up in the data object to decide whether to keep it (returns True) or filter it out (returns False).

process_data(data: Data) → Data[source]¶

Returns a copy of the Data object where the list of indices for each existing group has potentially fewer elements than before.

class dimcat.filter.base.HasCadenceAnnotationsFilter(keep_empty_groups=False)[source]¶

Bases: Filter

Keeps only pieces whose ‘expanded’ includes at least one cadence.

criterion(index, data: Data) → bool[source]¶

Takes one index and (potentially) looks it up in the data object to decide whether to keep it (returns True) or filter it out (returns False).

class dimcat.filter.base.IsAnnotatedFilter(keep_empty_groups=False)[source]¶

Bases: Filter

Keeps only pieces for which an ‘expanded’ DataFrame is available.

criterion(index, data: Data) → bool[source]¶

Takes one index and (potentially) looks it up in the data object to decide whether to keep it (returns True) or filter it out (returns False).
